3a6265d9-a981-4600-b577-11ed2c128f35.description: Badge recipients are verified to be able to promptly recognize several life-threatening emergencies, give high-quality chest compressions, deliver appropriate ventilations and provide early use of an AED. Reflects science and education from the American Heart Association (AHA) Guidelines Update for CPR and Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC). This is not an AHA certificate; only validation of skills.
3a6265d9-a981-4600-b577-11ed2c128f35.name: Basic Life Support

97f36e84-6076-470d-b73b-9bf11da6b93e.description: Earners have demonstrated the knowledge required to effectively teach transcripted credit courses to their high school students. The demonstration of knowledge includes competence in their chosen course of course-specific outcomes, objectives, and more.
97f36e84-6076-470d-b73b-9bf11da6b93e.name: Transcripted Credit Certified Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a LTC faculty administered/approved assessment that includes identity verification for current high school instructors seeking to obtain approval to teach transcripted credit courses for high school students
Meet the respective requirements of HLC depending on the course/division

0c3a3495-e097-4f0d-aabf-f9c2571553d2.description: Badge recipients are verified to be able to perform first aid basics for the most common first aid emergencies, including how to recognize them, how to call for help, and how to perform lifesaving skills. Reflects science and education from the American Heart Association (AHA) Guidelines Update for CPR and Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC) and the 2015 AHA/Red Cross Guidelines for First Aid. This is not an AHA certificate; only validation of related skills.
0c3a3495-e097-4f0d-aabf-f9c2571553d2.name: Heartsaver First Aid

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completion any one of these LTC courses: 47531416, 47531506, 47531509, 42531470

68546454-f7f2-43a3-a5e1-6c782f787513.description: This course enables the student to use spreadsheet features such as creating, saving, editing, navigating, formatting worksheets; entering formulas and functions; working with charts; and developing multiple-sheet workbooks.
68546454-f7f2-43a3-a5e1-6c782f787513.name: Microsoft Excel Introduction

badge_template_activities.title: Complete class with a letter grade of "C" or better

6e10a6f1-5cf3-4e3e-8c21-03234052c98c.description: Earners are empowered on worker rights and responsibilities, employer responsibilities, as well as how to identify, avoid and/or prevent job-related hazards. Earners understand a variety of general industry safety and health topics that a worker may encounter in the workplace. Training emphasizes OSHA standards, health hazard identification and avoidance, as well as control and prevention related to walking/working surfaces, exit routes, electrical, and personal protective equipment.
6e10a6f1-5cf3-4e3e-8c21-03234052c98c.name: OSHA 10-hour General Industry

alignments.name: OSHA 10-Hour
alignments.description: The 10-hour training program is primarily intended for entry level workers. All outreach training is intended to cover an overview of the hazards a worker may encounter on a job site. Training emphasizes hazard identification, avoidance, control and prevention.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion in any one of these 10-hour classes: 47529446, 47529490OG, 10449114

ba444168-9b66-454e-89b6-0a50b148cc98.description: Those who have earned the LTC Customer Service badge have demonstrated effective way of engaging with all customers, shown various ways to give customers alternative solutions, applied the rules of owning each situation, anticipated customer needs, and distinguished various methods of customer communication.
ba444168-9b66-454e-89b6-0a50b148cc98.name: Customer Service

alignments.name: AHLEI
alignments.description: Competencies selected from AHLEI (American Hotel Lodging Education Institute)

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstration of competencies (in badge description) through either: 1) the "5 Keys of Customer Service" internal LTC class; or 2) a project, course, co-curricular, or other activities as verified by an LTC faculty/staff member

366cedf3-022d-4512-81da-b7f3d84d7a5e.description: Earners of this designation are able to manage food serving environments following the National Restaurant Association criteria. Earners demonstrate the ability to direct safe food handling procedures, adhere to local health codes, and manage the related food supply chain.
366cedf3-022d-4512-81da-b7f3d84d7a5e.name: ServSafe® Food Manager

alignments.name: ServSafe
alignments.description: LTC is one of many avenues for coursework toward the ServSafe Manager exam. LTC is not the issuer of the official ServSafe certificate; this badge is a representation of having successfully completed the ServSafe exam within LTC's coursework. ServSafe certificates can also be validated through the official ServSafe website.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of either course: 10109112 or 47303411. (Success in course means a passing grade on ServSafe® Food Protection Manager Certification exam plus 16 hours in-class participation and assessments)

bd3959da-9b76-4d68-a749-f7a8f5dfbc30.description: Courses that earn this this badge are verified to be student-centered and configured in an easy to navigate manner. The course shows alignment from the course-level competencies, through the module-level objectives, assessments, and learning activities. The course and materials within are also all accessible for students.
bd3959da-9b76-4d68-a749-f7a8f5dfbc30.name: Certified Quality Course

badge_template_activities.title: Course review and approval by the LTC Quality Course Review Team

745c0cd9-d262-4b3a-8b98-ed4b2c27d705.description: Those who have earned the LTC Certified Quality Course Designer badge have demonstrated the ability to create a student-centered course. They have proven knowledge in course design and appearance to enhance student success. Earners have also able to create an aligned course from the course level objectives to learning activities. The course designer also applies accessibility standards through out the course.
745c0cd9-d262-4b3a-8b98-ed4b2c27d705.name: Certified Quality Course Designer

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Configuration Course.
Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Alignment Course.
Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Accessibility Course.

65365ace-f175-4439-9466-b5dd16edafb2.description: Earners are knowledgeable of detailed information about how the provisions of the Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA) must be implemented in the workplace, not only to achieve OSHA compliance, but to achieve quality expectations of business partners. Knowledge includes hazard recognition, hazard avoidance and abatement, prevention, and safety management. In addition, earners are knowledgeable about employer responsibilities and worker rights.
65365ace-f175-4439-9466-b5dd16edafb2.name: OSHA 30-hour General Industry

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the OSHA 30-hour General Industry course (47529447 OSHA 30 Hour General Industry) with a passing grade.

c119d90b-74aa-44af-b1f5-af3c0f92a718.description: Those who have earned the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Accessibility badge have demonstrated competence in online and blended course accessibility. They are knowledgeable in accessible text, images, files, documents, multimedia, web pages, and technology.
c119d90b-74aa-44af-b1f5-af3c0f92a718.name: Quality Course Design - Course Accessibility

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Accessibility Course.

27996780-0b12-4fa6-9f0c-e68a2a047af3.description: Those who have earned the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Alignment badge have demonstrated the ability to create a course with proper alignment. They are competent in instructional design, aligning course level competencies to module level competencies, assessments, and learning activities.
27996780-0b12-4fa6-9f0c-e68a2a047af3.name: Quality Course Design - Course Alignment

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Alignment Course.

94d77f90-64c1-4a69-a13e-f3f610234ac7.description: Those who have earned the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Configuration badge have demonstrated the knowledge and skills of course layout to benefit learners. These earners understand the importance of course introduction, expectations, and community within the course.
94d77f90-64c1-4a69-a13e-f3f610234ac7.name: Quality Course Design - Course Configuration

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the LTC Quality Course Design- Course Configuration Course.

800eec43-7404-4d06-98f2-12bd5811d398.description: Students demonstrate a basic knowledge of the core Microsoft Office software programs along with basic operating system knowledge. They have knowledge in file management; creating a basic document, workbook, presentation, and database; and modifying existing files.
800eec43-7404-4d06-98f2-12bd5811d398.name: Microsoft Office Introduction

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all of these courses: 10103121, 10103161, 10103191, 10103101

16c75702-af25-4928-a412-54d33e3748e3.description: Earners have satisfied the training requirements of OSHA's 29 CFR 1910.120 Technician Level training. They have competency from the awareness level to the technician level. Earners are proficient in air monitoring and exercise, decontamination, emergency response simulations, emergency response SOPs, hazard recognition and identification exercises, incident command, personal protective equipment, respiratory protection, spill control, toxicology, medical monitoring, and heat stress.
16c75702-af25-4928-a412-54d33e3748e3.name: 40-hr Industrial Emergency Response Technician

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 40-hr Industrial Emergency Response Technician course (47529474 Industrial Emergency Response 40-hr Technician) with a passing grade.

1ab2bc0a-e528-46d1-8651-61012f0c3650.description: Earners take innovative concepts and communicate those to others through in-person and virtual public forums such as competitions, demonstrations, and conferences. Earners identify gaps in the marketplace or a specific niche that are viable concepts in a for or not-for profit setting.
1ab2bc0a-e528-46d1-8651-61012f0c3650.name: Entrepreneurial Pitch Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the Entrepreneurial competition (LTC, NWTC, FVTC, and MPTC) and present a meaningful project with innovative merit.

22733cf6-ff15-4d8b-b1c9-f2ee35ab3e0d.description: Earner demonstrates superior skills in: Identifying a problem or gap, and relationship to the customer or market served; Demonstrating unique value proposition and solution concept; Planning for marketing and growth strategy; Distinguishing economic feasibility; Providing a quality presentation.
22733cf6-ff15-4d8b-b1c9-f2ee35ab3e0d.name: Entrepreneurial Pitch Skills – Competition Winner

badge_template_activities.title: Presented an award in the Entrepreneurial competition (LTC, NWTC, FVTC, and MPTC) for a meaningful project with innovative merit.

df98f5e1-ac0f-459a-8431-67ec2bdba325.description: Earner surpasses student, staff, or college needs through excellent customer service to create a welcoming environment, process improvement, or contributions to a project by: 1) Takes extra time and uses interpersonal skills or college knowledge to create an individualized experience; 2) Takes initiative/responsibility to follow through to contribute to project success that may fall outside of job duties; 3) Anticipates student, staff, or college needs to contribute to process improvement.
df98f5e1-ac0f-459a-8431-67ec2bdba325.name: Inspire

alignments.name: Lakeshore Leadership Development Institute (LLDI)
alignments.description: This internal College opportunity helps participants further develop individual, team, and organizational leadership skills and strengthen their knowledge of leadership practices specific to LTC. LLDI provides the opportunity to better understand individual leadership styles through assessments, coaching, and other learning activities.

badge_template_activities.title: LTC Faculty/Staff submits to LTC HR office an earner's application of one of the three competencies. Can be issued multiple badges for more than one competency.

59fa068a-202d-4b42-9228-2aa6ee9ee619.description: Earner demonstrates one or more of these: 1) Exhibits and prioritizes mindful and personal development; 2) demonstrates delegating, coaching, and/ or mentoring others; 3) maintains a flexible mindset while exhibiting strategic and innovative thinking; 4) recognizes ethical practice while benefiting the organization or community; or 5) effectively inspires and communicates with cross cultural consideration.
59fa068a-202d-4b42-9228-2aa6ee9ee619.name: Leader

alignments.name: Lakeshore Leadership Development Institute (LLDI)
alignments.description: This internal College opportunity helps participants further develop individual, team, and organizational leadership skills and strengthen their knowledge of leadership practices specific to LTC. LLDI provides the opportunity to better understand individual leadership styles through assessments, coaching, and other learning activities.

badge_template_activities.title: LTC Faculty/Staff submits to LTC HR office an earner's application of one of the five competencies. Can be issued multiple badges for more than one competency.

62863e57-a6bf-4b0e-833b-8e18fd512d7d.description: Learner will confidently meet consumer needs in an optical environment by efficiently communicating disease, treatment, follow up, lens choice, and frame selection. Additionally, earner will apply a clinical optical experience to improve patient overall care and communication. This skill set is part of LTC's Ophthalmic Medical Assistant Technical Diploma.
62863e57-a6bf-4b0e-833b-8e18fd512d7d.name: Optical

badge_template_activities.title: Successful course completion in these optical-skill courses: 31516320 Basic Optical Concepts 31516316 Frame Characteristics 31516317 Eyewear Adjustment 31516318 Ophthalmic Lens Selections 31516319 Frame Styling and Purchasing 31516321 Lens Power and Protection 31516322 Compare Multifocal Lenses 31516349 Ophthalmic Prism 31516331 Front Desk and Patient Triage 31516351 Administration Clinical 31516307 Ocular Disease and Treatment

c27441a8-77f4-47f5-ac89-480f8fa4815f.description: Earners of the Powered Industrial Truck Safety Badge know basic lift truck principles, lift truck components and controls, safe driving and load handling principles, and vehicle inspection for lift truck operators. They are knowledgeable of OSHA rules and regulations pertaining to safe lift truck operations according to 1910.178 requirements.
c27441a8-77f4-47f5-ac89-480f8fa4815f.name: Powered Industrial Truck Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 3-hr or more Powered Industrial Truck Safety training course (47449427 - Powered Industrial Truck (PIT) Safety) with a passing grade.
